intro: Randia subcordata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows as an herb or shrub and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Randia subcordata is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
